subject: Self Care
title: Batching Digital Tasks
description: A fast breakdown of Batching Digital Tasks for builders.

hook.text: Checking email 15 times a day costs three hours in context-switching. Checking it three times saves most of that.

buildup.text: Batching means grouping similar digital tasks into scheduled blocks instead of responding to each one as it arrives.

discovery.text: Cal Newport found that batching email to two or three set times daily improved both productivity and well-being.

twist.text: People fear missing urgent messages. In practice, truly urgent matters arrive by phone call, not email. Trust the batch.

climax.text: Set three email times: morning, midday, late afternoon. Close the inbox between them. Guard your focus fiercely.

punchline.text: Batch your digital tasks. Constant checking wastes hours daily.

quiz.question: What is digital task batching?
options: Grouping similar tasks into scheduled blocks instead of reacting to each
